intro: Eugenia petriei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Eugenia petriei is an important part of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in moist, forested areas.
